intro: Mesosphaerum longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved mesosphaerum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
